page.title: 18FIRE AT THE CHURCH!
page.content: The fire began around 8.45 on January 9 1985. At 9.00 there was a banging at the curate's door and someone told him that the church was on fire. He was asked to go into the church to point out items of interest to the fire chief. When the thick smoke had cleared they could see the full extent of the damage: the boiler house had set light to the organ which in turn set light to the north aisle roof. The plastic hooks supporting the lighting melted and created a wierd effect with wires hanging about 30 feet above the floor. The resins in the wooden beams ran out onto the floor creating intense heat. The fire eventually was brought under control. Everything in the area was destroyed. Fortunately the stained glass window had been moved from its original position and was not damaged. Approx. value of damage 150000 pounds.
